ReportText: EXAM: XR CHEST 1 VIEW DATE: 04/17/2018 12:00 AM HISTORY: atelectasis TECHNIQUE: Single frontal view(s) of the chest is/are submitted. COMPARISON: 04/16/2018 at approximately 11:29 AM FINDINGS: Rotated. Endotracheal tube tip is approximately 6.6 cm from the carina. Enteric tube courses below the diaphragm with distal tip not seen on image. Stable appearance of cardiomediastinal silhouette. No significant change in pulmonary vascular congestion. Increase in bilateral perihilar and bibasilar airspace opacities. No definite pneumothorax. No other significant change. IMPRESSION: 1. Support tubes as described above. 2. Worsening pulmonary vascular congestion. 3. Worsening bilateral perihilar and bibasilar edema, atelectasis, and/or infection. Electronically signed by [[PERSONALNAME]] on 04/17/2018 6:36 AM
